summary: SmartCare Connect: a mobile + wearable remote patient monitoring system for post-discharge care, syncing vitals from connected devices to doctors, with reminders, alerts, and optional telehealth services.
architectural_notes: System spans mobile app + device integrations + clinician notifications; requires secure health data transmission/storage.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal healthcare app logo mark with a caring/connected motif (smartcare-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Warm, modern banner illustration showing post-discharge monitoring at home (smartcare-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
- Blood pressure cuff icon, simple flat style (icon-bp.dim_256x256.png)
- Glucose meter icon, simple flat style (icon-glucose.dim_256x256.png)
- Pulse oximeter icon, simple flat style (icon-spo2.dim_256x256.png)
- Smartwatch heart rate icon, simple flat style (icon-hr.dim_256x256.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and role-based onboarding so a user can register as a Patient, Doctor/Clinician, or Family Member, and be routed to the correct dashboard after login.

Build a Patient dashboard that supports post-discharge onboarding and daily use: profile summary, connected devices list (as a configurable list), vitals entry (manual), medication reminders, follow-up appointments, and an Emergency/SOS button.
Build a Doctor/Clinician dashboard with patient roster, patient detail view, vitals timeline/table, and alert feed for emergency and abnormal-vitals events.

Implement medication reminders and follow-up appointment CRUD: patients (and/or their doctors) can create, update, list, and delete medication schedules and appointments; patient UI surfaces upcoming items.
Add Family Member access: patients can grant/revoke a family memberâ€™s read-only access to their status (recent vitals + alerts + upcoming reminders/appointments).
Add a Home Nurse booking request feature: patients can submit a booking request form (date/time window, address/details notes), and doctors can view submitted requests for their patients.
Provide a basic in-app 'Health Q&A' chatbot experience implemented without external AI services (e.g., curated FAQ + guided prompts + safety disclaimers), focused on post-discharge basics.
Create a coherent, distinct visual theme for SmartCare Connect and apply it consistently across pages (typography, color palette, spacing, cards, and alerts). Avoid a blue/purple default look.

Add generated brand and UI imagery as static assets and use them in the UI (no backend image routing): app logo, a simple hero/banner illustration for the landing/login screen, and 4 vitals-type icons.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build patient mobile app for post-discharge monitoring and onboarding
Integrate health devices (smart BP machine, glucometer, pulse oximeter, smartwatch) and collect vitals
Automatically transmit collected health data to doctor/clinician view
Medication reminders and follow-up appointment alerts
Abnormal vitals detection and notifications to doctor
AI chatbot for basic health questions
Family member access to patient status/data

Create backend data models and persistence for users (role + profile), patient-doctor relationships, family access grants, vitals readings, medication reminders, follow-up appointments, emergency alerts, and notification events.
Implement abnormal vitals detection rules in the backend and create a notification event when new readings exceed configured thresholds for that patient.
